attributes.action: Raise the personal income tax allowance instead of cutting taxes
attributes.additional_details:
The tax cuts only help the people higher up the scale, the government should be starting from the lower paid it's them who are struggling with the cost of living not the people on salaries above £50,000 per year.

By increasing the personal allowance this will start helping people on the lower incomes by freeing up more money to help with the cost of living.

This would also boost the economy as more people will want to work to earn more and will spend more.
attributes.background: Help the people on the lower incomes take home more if their hard earned money

rejection.details:
There are several petitions already open which are calling for different changes to income tax. You might like to sign one or more of them:

Raise the standard Personal TAX Allowance from £12,570 to £20,000
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/618661

Raise the income tax personal allowance to £15000 immediately
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/617227

Lower the standard rate of income tax due to cost of living increases
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/613191

Lower the basic rate income tax from 20% to 7.5%
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/616532

Change income tax thresholds to help for cost of living for everyone
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/621777

Remove income tax and National Insurance for those earning under £24k a year
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/622082

Reduce income tax from 20% to 10%
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/623329

50% reduction in all taxes
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/616403
